name: Welcome Back the Bats 2011
description:
The Mexican Free-Tailed Bat of the Sonoran Desert is illustrated in several stages of flight. The central image was drawn from live observation, and it is surrounded by small bat sketches.

This intricately detailed illustration was done for the "Welcome Back the Bats" benefit held by the Rillito River Project of Tucson, Arizona to celebrate the annual Spring migration of the bats back to Tucson. (http://www.rillitoriverproject.org/)

Printed on heavy, archival Breathing Color Optica paper with Epson pigmented inks. 6"x9" 

Open edition. Prints signed in pencil. Watermark at the top will not appear in the print.

name: Porcelain Crabs of Puerto Peñasco
description:
After a stay on the Sea of Cortéz in Sonora, Mexico, I've intricately illustrated three Porcelain Crab species that are endemic to the tide pools of the area. A caricature crab guides the viewer through the physiology of the porcelain crab in a way that is fun to read. 

This borderless poster is printed with brilliant pigmented inks on archival Epson Enhanced Matte Paper for glare-free viewing.

(The large watermark on the bottom-right corner will not appear on the print).
